newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Hooded gang executes three petty thiefs in Brazil.
newsitem.headline: Hooded gang executes three petty thiefs in Brazil.

text.p: Masked intruders burst into the homes of three men in Salvador in northeast Brazil and executed them in apparent retribution for petty crimes, police said on Saturday.
"We are still investigating the motive for the deaths," a local policeman told Reuters.
Three men were killed by gunshots on Friday night, the policeman said. They were Marcelo Oliveira, 16; Wellington Silva, 18, and Edson Araujo, whose age was not given.
Oliveira and Araujo were both killed in the street while Silva was murdered inside his home, the policeman said. He could give no further details on the killings.
Local news agency Agencia do Estado reported that both Oliveira and Araujo were dragged out of their homes by three hooded men and gunned down in the street.
The assassinations took place in a suburb of Salvador reputed for drug trafficking and violence, the news agency said.
The victims allegedly stole from local bars and small businesses and police were working with the theory that their killers were hired to get rid of them, it added.
